meanings.definition: The state or quality of being rancid.
meanings.sent1: The rancidity of the old oil made the whole kitchen smell bad.
meanings.sent2: I could smell the rancidity of the spoiled milk as soon as I opened the carton.
meanings.sent3: The rancidity of the cheese was so strong, it could walk out of the fridge on its own!
meanings.sent4: The rancidity of the situation was palpable, like a cloud of decay hanging in the air.
meanings.sent5: The rancidity of the fish was so intense, it lingered in the room long after it was thrown out.

meanings.sent1: The slow rancidity of the butter was evident by its unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent2: Exposure to air can accelerate the rancidity of certain foods.
meanings.sent3: The rancidity of the fruit was like a race against time, turning from fresh to foul in days.
meanings.sent4: The rancidity of the oil spread through the pantry like a creeping mold.
meanings.sent5: The rancidity of the meat was a reminder of the importance of proper storage and handling.

meanings.sent1: The rancidity of the cheese was overpowering, making it inedible.
meanings.sent2: The rancidity of the fish was so strong, it made me gag.
meanings.sent3: The rancidity of the milk was like a punch in the face, sour and unpleasant.
meanings.sent4: The rancidity of the dish was a bitter reminder of forgetting to refrigerate it.
meanings.sent5: The rancidity of the sauce was so intense, it coated my tongue with a foul taste.
